india.title: Global: Gender apartheid must be recognized as a crime under international law
india.summary:
Gender apartheid must be recognized as a crime under international law in order to strengthen efforts to combat institutionalized regimes of systematic oppression and domination imposed on the grounds of gender, said Amnesty International today.
We are calling for the recognition of gender apartheid under international law to fill a major gap in our global legal framework.
Agnès Callamard, Amnesty International’s Secretary General“Today we are joining the calls of courageous trailblazers, including women of Afghanistan, Iran and beyond, who have led the way in demanding recognition of gender apartheid in international law.
The closest approximation under the current international framework is persecution on the basis of gender, which international law, such as in the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court, recognizes as a crime against humanity.
An international campaign for the recognition of gender apartheid in international law has drawn wide support from feminist activists and allies globally, including four women Nobel Peace Prize Laureates.

india.title: Brent Rutemiller, Former International Swimming Hall of Fame CEO, Dies
india.summary:
After a three-year battle with cancer, former International Swimming Hall of Fame (ISHOF) CEO and a colleague of everyone in the swimming community Brent Rutemiller died in the early hours of Monday morning.
Rutemiller was diagnosed with plasma-cell leukemia in May 2021, which he battled into remission despite no known cure.
Rutemiller had a long career in swimming, from coaching stops across the country, more than 30 years in various roles with Swimming World, and five years as the CEO of the ISHOF in addition to serving as its President.
Rutemiller got his start with Swimming World Magazine in 1985 as the creator of Aquazoids, an educational animated series that has been printed in more than 150 countries.
During his time as publisher, Rutemiller spearheaded Swimming World’s partnership with the ISHOF.

india.title: Sybrand Engelbrecht retires from international cricket
india.summary:
Engelbrecht retired from all cricket in 2016 to focus on his career in financial and project management, and he began playing cricket recreationally in the Netherlands after moving there in 2021.
By 2023, he was in the Netherlands national squad, having been picked for the 2023 ODI World Cup in India.
He has retired now at 35, having played exactly half his international cricket - eight of his 12 ODIs and four of his 12 T20Is - in World Cups.
He finishes with 385 ODI runs at an average of 35.00, with two half-centuries, and 280 T20I runs at 31.11 and a strike rate of 132.70.
He was Netherlands' highest run-getter at this T20 World Cup, with 98 runs at 24.50 including 40 and 33 in close defeats to Full Members South Africa and Bangladesh.

india.title: Supporting International CDKL5 Day
india.summary:
Every June the CDKL5 community comes together to recognize CDKL5 disorder, and promote awareness efforts, research, collaboration, and fundraising.
June 17 is International CDKL5 Day, in memory of Glyn Boltwood, whose life and legacy was directly responsible for the medical and scientific community discovering CDKL5 Disorder in 2004.
CDKL5 deficiency disorder – a Developmental and Epileptic Encephalopathy (DEE) - is a genetic disorder that causes seizures, developmental delay, and severe intellectual disability.
CDKL5 deficiency disorder occurs more often in females than males, and males usually have more severe symptoms.
CDKL5 deficiency disorder was once thought to be a variant of Rett syndrome but is now considered a separate disorder.

health.title: Recap: India Health Conference 2024
health.summary:
Recap: India Health Conference 2024The Scientific Congress on Challenges in Disease Management and Outcome brought together 175 participants and showcased 50 speakers, moderators and panelists in Mumbai on Feb. 9 - 10.
Organized by the India Gateway in collaboration with health partners in South Asia, this marked the fifth international conference of its kind, and strengthened the ongoing partnership between The Ohio State University and Nanavati Super Specialty Hospital.
The conference focused on critical areas of healthcare including maternal care and neonatal infections, evolving strategies in HIV and tuberculosis treatments, advancements in tropical disease vaccines, and the complexities of oncology and public health.
Attending the conference from Ohio State were Abhay Satoskar, Wexner Medical Center, and Raghu Machiraju, College of Engineering, and from the College of Medicine, Murugesan Rajaram, Amit Singh and Kartik Venkatesh.
The conference fostered rich networking opportunities, sparking considerable interest in partnership opportunities with Ohio State and served as a catalyst for knowledge exchange with a shared commitment to addressing healthcare challenges and improving outcomes in the region.

health.title: India: LIC denies reports it plans to acquire a health insurer

health.title: Catalyzing Clean Air in India
health.summary:
ContextGlobally, air pollution is a silent killer.
The air pollution levels in India are among the highest in the world, posing a heavy threat to the country's health and economy.
1.67 million deaths were attributable to air pollution in India in 2019, accounting for 17.8% of the total deaths in the country.
Lost output from premature deaths and morbidity attributable to air pollution accounted for economic losses of US$28.8 billion and $8 billion, respectively, in India in 2019.
The air pollution challenge in India is therefore inherently multi-sectoral and multi-jurisdictional, requiring an “airshed” approach.

health.title: Why a New Study Dubbed India the ‘Cancer Capital of the World’
health.summary:
Despite reporting more than a million new cases every year, India’s cancer rate has not yet surpassed countries like Denmark, Ireland, and Belgium, which record some of the highest cancer rates in the world.
In particular, the number of cancer cases is expected to rise at a rate that will surpass global averages—from 1.39 million in 2020 to 1.57 million by 2025.
Among women, the most common forms of cancer are breast cancer, cervix cancer, and ovarian cancer.
Among men, they are lung cancer, mouth cancer, and prostate cancer.
While men generally report a 25% higher incidence of cancer than women globally, India bucks this trend with more women getting diagnosed with cancer, according to a study published in the Lancet Oncology.

health.title: No formal proposal to enter health insurance: LIC
health.summary:
NEW DELHI: The Life Insurance Corporation ( LIC ) on Friday clarified that there is currently no official proposal to venture into the health insurance sector .
As per existing regulations, life insurance companies are not permitted to offer health insurance policies, which are exclusively sold by general insurers or dedicated health insurance providers.In a regulatory filing, LIC said, "We hereby clarify that at present, no such formal proposal (for health insurance via private health insurer) has been initiated.
"However, the company added that it regularly assesses and explores various strategic opportunities, including inorganic growth options and strategic partnerships, as part of its normal business operations.There is anticipation that composite licenses, allowing insurers to provide life, general, or health insurance under a single entity, may be introduced through amendments to the Insurance Act.
Currently, the Insurance Act , 1938, and the regulations set by the Insurance Regulatory Development Authority of India (Irdai) do not permit composite licensing .In February, a parliamentary panel , chaired by BJP leader Jayant Sinha, recommended the introduction of composite licensing for insurance companies to increase insurance penetration in India.
The panel suggested that the government make the necessary legislative amendments at the earliest.The report, which was presented in Parliament, highlighted the potential benefits of composite licensing, such as reduced costs and compliance hassles for insurers, as they can operate different insurance lines under one roof.

Menon has officiated in 23 Tests, 58 ODIs and 45 T20Is (126 matches overall) as an on-field umpire.
Venkataraghavan officiated in 73 Tests and 52 ODIs (125 matches) as an on-field umpire.
Menon is India's only umpire in the ICC Elite Panel, where he was inducted in 2020.

sports.title: Bhajan Kaur wins gold to earn Paris quota
sports.summary:
KOLKATA: Unheralded Bhajan Kaur earned India an Olympic quota place in the women's recurve archery by winning gold in the final Olympic Qualifier tournament in Antalya, Turkey, on Sunday.
Her teammate Ankita Bhakat too was eligible for the quota place when the Kolkata-born archer made the quarterfinals, but the single berth on offer in the event finally went to Kaur as she fared better than Bhakat.India, who missed out on team quota places in both men's and women's categories earlier in the competition, will thus make it to the mixed team event too in Paris as Dhiraj Bommadevara had already won a men's quota place.
However, all eyes will be on the world rankings position after the World Cup Stage III event in Antalya, which will deter mine whether the Indian archers will manage to win team quota places.Deepika Kumari , however, crashed out, going down to Azerbaijan's Yaylagul Ramazanova 4-6 in the third round after leading 4-0.Ankita too earns placeAnkita Bhakat outplayed Gabrielle Monica Bidaure of Philippines 6-0 (26-23, 28-22, 28-23) to enter the quarterfinals on Sunday and grab an individual quota.
India thus have secured individual quotas in both men's and women's sections.
Dhiraj Bommadevara had secured the men's individual quota.

The T20 World Cup's Florida-based matches continued to be blighted by bad weather as India's game with Canada was abandoned without a ball being bowled.
All three matches scheduled for Lauderhill have now fallen to the elements, with the ground suffering the effects of heavy rainfall over the last week.
The abandonment has no effect on the outcome of Group A, with India already qualified for the Super 8s and eliminated Canada's tournament now at an end.
India's next match will be in the second stage on Thursday against Afghanistan, while Lauderhill is due to stage its final match, Pakistan against Ireland, on Sunday.

sports.summary: T20 WORLD CUP:|Watch VideoThe behind-the-scenes stories of any event often grab eyeballs and attention of those following it closely, and the global sporting events like the ongoing T20 World Cup in the US and the Caribbean islands are no different.In one such video shot by a fan from the stands at a stadium in the US -- possibly the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York , legends Sunil Gavaskar and Wasim Akram could be seen grooving to the music played by the DJ at the venue.Former Pakistan captain Akram was doing a show for the tournament's host broadcasters, Star Sports, along with India's batting legend and ex-skipper Gavaskar close to the boundary ropes when the duo suddenly took a break and started dancing to the tunes of the DJ.The anchor of the show could be seen capturing the moment in a selfie, while the two legends continued to enjoy their moves.The ninth edition of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup began on June 2 and will concluded with the final on June 29 in Barbados.

Changes expected under the new tax regimeDespite offering lower tax rates, the new tax regime has not gained significant traction among taxpayers.
Currently, section 80C benefits are not available under the default (new) tax regime.

finance.title: Finance minister to meet economists, farm bodies for pre-Budget talk
finance.summary:
NEW DELHI: As part of her pre-budget consultations with stakeholders, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman will meet farmers' associations and agriculture economists on Friday and seek their suggestions on the policy landscape for the politically and economically crucial sector.
"Ideas and suggestions of stakeholders are thoroughly discussed before budget preparation.
It's a standard procedure and is followed for finalising the budget for all ministries/sectors," said an official.
This time, however, given complaints of farm and rural distress, the agriculture sector will be a crucial component of the budget and will also outline the Modi govt's strategy for the coming five years.Promises made in the interim budget may get a concrete shape with more specific allocation, sources said.Sitharaman had in her interim budget announced that the government will formulate a strategy to make the country self-reliant on edible oils by boosting domestic output of oilseeds, come out with a comprehensive programme to support dairy farmers, and set up five integrated aqua parks and launch new climate resilient scheme for blue economy 2.0 for fisheries development.“Making India self-reliant in oil seeds such as mustard, groundnut, sesame, soybean, and sunflower is expected to remain a focus area of the budget as India currently has to import a large quantity of edible oils to meet its domestic demand," said the source.
During the 2022-23 marketing year (November-October), India imported nearly 165 lakh tonnes of cooking oils worth almost Rs 1.4 lakh crore.Multiple farmer welfare measures and promotion of private and public investment in “post-harvest activities” including aggregation, modern storage, efficient supply chains, processing, marketing and branding may also be other focus areas of the budget for the farm sector, said the sources.

finance.title: Can I take benefit of India-UAE DTAA?
finance.summary:
Two important changes that refer to the threshold of ₹15 lakh relate to (a) Indian citizens visiting India; and (b) Indian citizens not paying taxes anywhere across the world, respectively.
In your case, since you have obtained TRC from the UAE tax authorities, it is presumed that you are eligible to access India-UAE DTAA benefits.
Because of the Finance Act 2020 amendments, if you become a resident under the Indian tax law, you may apply the tie-breaker tests provided under the India-UAE DTAA to determine the treaty residence in your case.
In your case, if the tie breaks are in favour of the UAE, then you can apply the provisions of the India-UAE DTAA as if you are a tax resident of UAE, notwithstanding the amendments made vide Finance Act 2020.
Under the India-UAE DTAA, India has been allocated the right to tax capital gains arising from the sale of shares, whereas India does not have the right to tax capital gains arising from redemption of mutual funds.

finance.title: IFC to finance Brookfield’s 550-MW solar power project in Rajasthan, ET EnergyWorld
finance.summary:
AdvtAdvtJoin the community of 2M+ industry professionals Subscribe to our newsletter to get latest insights & analysis.
Download ETEnergyworld App Get Realtime updatesSave your favourite articles Scan to download AppNew Delhi: International Finance Corporation ( IFC ) has committed to part finance a 550 MW solar power project in Bikaner, Rajasthan being developed by Brookfield Asset Management with $105 million through long-term non-convertible debentures allocated to the project's special purpose vehicles, which are implementing the project.According to the official press release, following its commitment, Brookfield will provide solar power to commercial and industrial consumers across India at more competitive tariffs through long-term power purchase agreements (PPAs) and contribute to the nation’s decarbonization goals.“This is IFC’s first investment in Asia and the Pacific using an innovative hybrid offtake structure where the project sells the power generated to C&I consumers under long-term corporate PPAs and merchant markets via exchange,” it added.The release said that the project will be connected to the inter-state transmission system section of India’s green energy corridor.“Through our partnership with Brookfield, IFC aims to facilitate the broader uptake of clean energy by demonstrating the viability of large-scale renewable energy generation, and sale to pan-India corporate and industrial clients, through the interstate transmission system,” said Imad N Fakhoury, IFC's Regional Director for South Asia.Fakhoury added that the novel procurement options underscore the role of hybrid transactions in scaling up investments in renewables, increasing market competitiveness, and offsetting the energy sector’s carbon footprint — key to achieving India’s climate goals.“We are pleased to collaborate with IFC, sharing a common goal through this strategic partnership… We plan to continue to expand our renewable and energy transition footprint in India focusing on both state utility and C&I segments in the country.
With a portfolio of over 25 GW of renewable power assets in operation or in development across leading platforms in the country, we look forward to capitalizing on the scaled transition opportunities on offer in the country,” said Nawal Saini, managing director, renewable power and transition, Brookfield.Since 2010, IFC has invested $2.79 billion in multiple projects to strengthen the renewable energy and energy efficiency sectors in India.

The credit for the opposition’s performance, Mr Kidwai says, largely goes to Mr Gandhi, the much criticised scion of the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty.
It also gave him confidence and political heft.” But Mr Gandhi was still not perceived as a threat to Mr Modi.
But the biggest upset for Mr Modi and the BJP, Mr Bose says, came from the bellwether state of Uttar Pradesh (UP).
The BJP’s tally has been restricted to a poor 33.” Mr Modi's party won 62 seats in 2019 and took 71 in 2014.

politics.title: India's Gandhi wins 'rebirth' after shock election comeback
politics.summary:
NEW DELHI -- Rahul Gandhi's political career was on life support five years ago.
The leader of India's opposition Congress party -- and scion of the Nehru-Gandhi political dynasty -- had just suffered a thumping defeat to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in 2019 polls.
Losing his family's long-held constituency seat in the election drubbing, Gandhi quit as the head of Congress, while Modi and the BJP mocked the great-grandson of India's first post-independence leader as an unserious dilettante who they dubbed "the prince".

politics.title: Trudeau, Modi meet for first time since Canada publicly accused India of Sikh leader's assassination
politics.summary:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi have met for the first time since Trudeau publicly accused Modi's government of involvement in the assassination of a Canadian Sikh activist.
"The prime minister congratulated Prime Minister Modi on his re-election and the leaders had a brief discussion on the bilateral relationship," Ann-Clara Vaillancourt said in a media statement.
Last met in 2023Earlier on Friday, Trudeau and Modi were both around the same G7 table during an outreach session.
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, left, is welcomed by Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni at the G7 in Borgo Egnazia, near Bari, in southern Italy, on Friday.
One expert said Friday that the leaders' meeting may be a sign that relations between India and Canada are improving.

politics.title: Indian voters dissect Modi’s politics while traversing the country by train
politics.summary:
India’s overcrowded trains are seen as a metaphor for its chaotic, diverse and unequal democracy, riven by class, caste and religion.
As the world’s largest democracy holds one of most consequential elections ever, the India team decided to go on an 1,800-mile (2,900-kilometer) train journey to understand what matters to the Indian voters and what has changed in the 10 years of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s rule.
The aim was to lay out a clear plan for reporting, writing and filming, especially the inputs needed for digital presentation and social planning.
The package served both traditional and digital customers.
The sounds, sights and texture of the images both inside and outside the train captured the voices and mood of ordinary voters as the country’s six-week-long election enters its final stages.

politics.title: 'In India, a lower caste revolution is underway'
politics.summary:
In India, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) led by Narendra Modi lost the national elections of 2024 as they fell short of majority by 32 seats, a considerable number.
They will now form a coalition government with the regional anti-caste political parties they had previously opposed.
The judiciary and the hitherto minimally oppositional media will find it easier to pursue their vocations in the coming months.
On December 6, 1992, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (the upper caste supremacist paramilitary organization and the parent of the BJP) and its offshoots accomplished the demolition and unleashed pogroms against Muslims across India killing thousands.
Not only Modi, but also the so-called left and right in the upper caste media, proclaimed that he had already won the elections.
